passage_text: Cook for 20 minutes at 220°C then turn oven down to 180°C (medium heat) and cook roast for 45 minutes per kilogram. Rest under foil for 5-10 minutes. Without crackling-sear first in a pan. Place in a preheated 180°C oven and cook for 40 minutes per kilogram. Rest under foil for 5-10 minutes. To aid even cooking, place roast on an elevated rack in the oven or onto halved carrots or potatoes to elevate.

Place pork on a rack over a roasting dish and put in oven. Roast for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 150°C and continue cooking for 45 minutes per 500g. To check pork is cooked, pierce the thickest part with a knife: if the juices run clear, the pork is cooked.

Cooking Instructions: 1. Pre-heat oven to 220°c for 10 minutes. 2. Rub oil onto the whole surface of the rind and the flaked salt evenly over rind. 3. Bake the pork roast in the pre-heated oven for 20 minutes at 220°C. 4. Reduce the temperature 180°C for the remainder of the cooking time (dependant on the weight - 25 minutes per 500 g). 5. Peel red apples in a spiral pattern leaving half the skin in tact. Roll apples in the demara sugar and place in a baking dish.

Place the pork on top. Roast it in the centre of the oven for about 30 mins, until the skin starts to crisp up, then reduce the oven temperature to 180 C/350 F/Gas Mark 4, and cook for a further 2-2 hours.

Set the meat on a rack set into a roasting pan. Roast for 20 minutes, and then reduce the heat to 325 degrees F. Continue to cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the shoulder reads 185 degrees F, about 4 hours.
